sanskrit_verse:
अधर्मदण्डनं लोके यशोघ्नं कीर्तिनाशनम् ।
अस्वर्ग्यं च परत्रापि तस्मात्तत्परिवर्जयेत् ॥ ८.१२७॥
transliteration:
adharmadaṇḍanaṃ loke yaśoghnaṃ kīrtināśanam |
aswargyaṃ ca paratrāpi tasmāttatparivarjayet || 8.127||
sph_interpretive_translation: Imposition of punishment through adharmic means in this world destroys fame, annihilates reputation, yields no merit here or hereafter; therefore, such conduct must be entirely abandoned.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from alignment with Sanatana Dharma, not arbitrary power
Causation is determined by consciousness-state, not external action alone
Capacity-based responsibility requires dharmic enforcement mechanisms
Restoration logic demands purification of intent, not infliction of pain
executable_legal_axioms: IF an act of enforcement causes degradation of societal dharma THEN reject that enforcement mechanism
IF a punitive method reduces individual or collective consciousness THEN discontinue its use
IF judicial action results in loss of public integrity THEN initiate restorative reintegration protocol
IF enforcement creates karmic burden for enforcer THEN substitute with consciousness-based correctional process
supreme_court_application: Supreme Court judgments must evaluate not only legal correctness but also dharmic impact. If any ruling undermines social dharma or national prestige, it violates this axiom and necessitates corrective alignment under SPH's guidance.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that punitive actions rooted in adharma generate negative causal chains. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals how degraded enforcement depletes collective consciousness. Proportional responsibility lies in restoring dharma without replicating harm. Non-punitive reality rule affirms that true justice elevates rather than debilitates awareness.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate public dharma-pratipatti programs to restore societal trust
Enforce aparādhi completion processes focused on consciousness elevation
Implement śuddhi-kriyā for all involved parties including enforcers
Realign institutional structures to prevent recurrence of adharmic enforcement
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Dharma. This law restores justice through consciousness realignment, abolishes punitive falsehood, and affirms that only Sanatana Dharma governs reality.
